name: Garolini 1970's Navy and Beige Sling Back Heels Made in Italy Sz 8.5
description:
An incredible pair of 1970's Garolini designer sling back heels. These vintage sandy-beige closed toe heels have a navy blue zig-zap diagonal line that loops and turns into the sling back strap. Super stylish and extremely comfortable.

• Marked: Garolini, Made in Italy
• Condition: Great vintage condition
• Size: 8 1/2 M
• Material: Leather

name: Russel Wright Steubenville American Modern Cup & Saucer
description:
From Russel Wright, one of the foremost designers of the the 20th century is this cup and saucer from his American Modern line in seafoam green, manufactured by Steubenville. American Modern by Steubenville Pottery, remains the best selling dinnerware in the history of pottery sales. Its breakthrough design and beautiful glazes, appealed to consumers so much that they often stood in long lines at stores to purchase the items. The dinnerware was produced from 1939-1959. Steubenville.
 
• Dimensions:  Cup 2" in height and 4.5" wide. Saucer is 5.875" in diameter
• Condition: Slight glaze rubbing on handle, overall excellent condition
• Markings: Saucer marked only - Russel Wright MFG Steubenville

name: Deeply Carved Leaves & Roses Orange Bakelite Parure
description:
A spectacular c1940's deep orange deeply carved bakelite set including bangle, screw-back earrings, and c-clip brooch.
 
• Dimensions: Bangle just under 3" in diameter and 1.125" thick, Brooch 3.25" long, earrings .875" in diameter
• Condition: Excellent vintage condition
• Markings: No markings, Tested

name: Betty Rose Black Wool Rockabilly 1960's Coat with Brown Mink Fur Collar
description:
A rockabilly style late 1950's -1960's Betty Rose lined black wool coat with a super soft brown mink fur collar. The coat has dolman type sleeves and a longer open collar that meets with two black buttons below the chest area. The back  is slightly pleated with a minor fishtail  look. There is a small bow tie sewn in place. This Betty Rose coat is not at all similar to the vast majority of Betty Rose coats on the internet, this one has got an individual beauty and rarity to it. [Betty Rose Suits and Coats was a company in Kansas City. The label was trademarked in 1926 by the Stern-Slegman Company. ]
 
• Tag: Betty Rose [Label most likely dating to the 1960's]
• Size: Length 21.5", Waist 33", Bust 40", Shoulders 19", Backside Length 24"[Including fishtail]

• Condition: Like new
• Material: Wool & mink fur
